answers.answer: Hi!Increased monocyte count or monocytosis is seen in subacute bacterial endocarditis, syphilis (test for this as you are having rashes and weight loss),  viral infections, kala azar, malaria, Rocky Mountain spotted fever, lupus, rheumatoid arthritis, IBS, lipid storage diseases, sarcoidosis etc. Hence it is important to get a comple autoimmune panel and a STD panel. Also, you should test for mold infection. Systemic fungal infection is possible such as Candidiasis, Aspergillosis, Histoplasmosis, Blastomycosis, and Coccidioidomycosis. However these are seen in immunocompromised patients such as those on chemotherapy, dialysis, renal dysfunction, HIV, or other STDs or in patients with diabetes. Rarely this is seen in healthy individuals. Early diagnosis of systemic fungal infection is possible through Sandwich ELISA for circulating galactomannan, and Polymerase chain reaction (PCR). Test for diabetes too. Please discuss with your doctor. Take care!The medical advice given should not be considered a substitute for medical care provided by a doctor who can examine you. The advice may not be completely correct for you as the doctor cannot examine you and does not know your complete medical history. Hence this reply to your post should only be considered as a guiding line and you must consult your doctor at the earliest for your medical problem.

question: I am a F in my late 20s and for the past few years have had a variety of different health issues and it seems to just be getting worse within the past few months or so.  I'm not even sure which symptoms are related and which aren't.  I've had trouble with tachycardia for the past few years, with a high resting HR, SVT, and lately some occasional irregularity, which I'm not sure what it is.  I do see a cardiologist for it who is not so helpful.  My skin has gotten more and more sensitive and lately I've started to get frequent rashes, which can vary as to how they present.  I've use a free and clear type detergent and I'm careful with which type of lotions, washes, deoderants, etc that I use.  Sometimes the rash is a dermographic urticaria, sometimes it's just urticaria, sometimes it's just redness, etc.  Sometimes it burns and sometimes it itches.  I get rashes on my face, legs, arms, chest, neck.  I can get a rash on my face just from my face laying against something sometimes.  Most of the time I don't know what causes the rash.  I developed an adult onset of a mild cough variant asthma a couple of years ago and take meds for it.  I've never smoked, although was exposed to second hand smoke as a child but haven't been around it regularly in 13 years.  I can't seem to keep weight on and have lost about 23% of my body weight over the past year, leaving my with a BMI around 16.  I've developed livedo reticularis in my legs over the past month or so and it isn't related to temperature as it happens whether I'm hot or cold.  My hands are turning purple at times, again not related to temperature and doesn't look like Reynold's.  I'm bruising fairly easily but this may be due to weight loss.  My hair has gotten fairly thin, but this may be due to weight loss as well.  I get frequent feelings of pre-syncope, also related to weight loss?  I don't have POTS but do normally have a lower BP.  My coughing with the asthma seems to be worse lately, which I thought may be due to the cold weather but have also been getting frequent bouts of bronchitis.  No fevers that I'm aware of.  I do feel slightly out of breath every so often, even at rest.  Sometimes get a dull but mild chest pain which can last a few minutes or a few days.  One of the most annoying issues is that I'm exhausted most of the time, no matter how much I sleep and feel like I'm stuck in a mental fog where I can't think or process things at all.  The mental fog seems to be getting worse no matter what I do.  I do no have depression, am not anxious.  Have a normal chest x-ray and blood work was normal except for a slight elevation of monocytes (mine were at 15% and the upper nomal level cutoff was 20%).  I was tested for Lupus 3-4 years ago, which was negative.  I've also had an episode of MEWDS a year and a half ago.  Not sure where to go from here.  Have a PCP and a cardiologist.  Have an appt with dermatology but it's going to be a while before I go as they are pretty booked.
title: variety of symptoms and unsure of next step.
